fields.label: Five Year Snapshot
fields.helperText: What did you imagine in the practice? What are people worried about, using, or doing differently in 5 years?

fields.label: Why are you building a side hustle?
Trend 1: What change have you noticed?
fields.helperText: Example: More people working remotely and needing home office setups

fields.label: Trend 1: Where does this lead in 2-5 years?
fields.helperText: Example: More demand for productivity tools, ergonomic furniture, and remote collaboration

fields.label: Trend 2: What change have you noticed?
Trend 3: What change have you noticed?
Trend 4: What change have you noticed?
Trend 5: What change have you noticed?
Who will struggle most because of these changes?
fields.helperText: Example: Small business owners who lack tech skills, parents juggling remote work and childcare

fields.label: What specific problem will get worse for them?
fields.helperText: Example: Spending too much time on admin tasks, feeling isolated and unproductive

fields.label: What kind of help would they pay for?
fields.helperText: Example: Systems setup, coaching, templates, done-for-you services

fields.label: Opportunity Direction 1
fields.helperText: One area where you see potential. Example: Helping freelancers set up client management systems

fields.label: Which directions connect to your skills or interests?
fields.helperText: Note any connections between your life and these opportunities

fields.label: Skills: What do you know how to do?
fields.helperText: Include work skills, hobbies, and random knowledge. Example: Excel, cooking, photography, fixing bikes

fields.label: Access: What communities, groups, or networks do you belong to?
fields.helperText: Example: Parent groups, professional networks, online forums, student communities, languages you speak

fields.label: Tools: What equipment, software, or resources do you already have?
fields.helperText: Example: Camera, design software, car, large garage, spare room, professional licenses

fields.label: Wins: What have people thanked you for or asked your help with?
fields.helperText: Example: Friends always ask me to edit their photos, coworkers ask me to explain spreadsheets

fields.label: Your 5 to 8 strongest assets (circle the best from above)
fields.helperText: The ones that could create value for others

fields.label: Money Tree 1: Name this asset source
fields.helperText: Example: Photography skills

fields.label: Why is this valuable to someone?
fields.helperText: Example: People need photos but lack time or skill to take good ones themselves

fields.label: Idea Seed 1A from this tree
fields.helperText: Example: Event photography for small businesses

fields.label: Idea Seed 1B from this tree
fields.helperText: Example: Product photography for Etsy sellers

fields.label: Money Tree 2: Name this asset source
Why is this valuable to someone?
Money Tree 3: Name this asset source
Money Tree 4: Name this asset source
Money Tree 5: Name this asset source
Which idea seeds connect to your Day 1 opportunity directions?
fields.helperText: Star any seeds that match both an asset and a trend

fields.label: Total idea seeds generated today
fields.helperText: Aim for 10 to 20

fields.label: Which methods did you use today?
Brainstorm ideas: List 8 to 12 problems or frustrations you could solve
fields.helperText: Each problem is an idea. Example: People hate meal planning, parents need babysitter backup, freelancers lose receipts

fields.label: Borrow 1: What successful side hustle did you find?
fields.helperText: Example: Local dog walking service

fields.label: How would you adapt it for a different audience?
fields.helperText: Example: Cat sitting for apartment dwellers in my area

fields.label: Borrow 2: What successful side hustle did you find?
Borrow 3: What successful side hustle did you find?
Steal 1: What proven offer format did you identify?
fields.helperText: Example: Online course, membership, done-for-you service, templates

fields.label: How would you apply this format?
fields.helperText: Example: A course teaching home organization using my decluttering method

fields.label: How would you differentiate?
fields.helperText: Example: Focus on parents with small apartments, include video walkthroughs

fields.label: Mashups: What 2 to 3 weird combinations emerged?
fields.helperText: Example: Photography plus meal planning equals food styling tutorials for home cooks

fields.label: Total ideas generated today
fields.helperText: Count all ideas from all methods. Aim for at least 15

fields.label: Why might this work?
fields.helperText: 2 sentences on why this has potential

fields.label: Clarity Check: If you had to start one idea tomorrow, which would you pick?
fields.helperText: Your gut reaction before analysis

fields.label: If you had to drop one idea right now, which would go?
What are you afraid of with each idea?
fields.helperText: One fear per idea. Example: Idea 1 fear is no one will pay, Idea 2 fear is it will take too long

fields.label: Idea 1: One sentence description
fields.helperText: Example: Weekly meal planning service for busy parents who hate cooking decisions

fields.label: Idea 1: Estimated days to launch first version
fields.helperText: Example: 7

fields.label: Idea 1: Estimated startup cost in dollars
fields.helperText: Example: 50

fields.label: Idea 1: Opportunity score (1-10)
fields.helperText: How good is the upside? 10 is best

fields.label: Idea 1: Obstacle score (1-10)
fields.helperText: How hard are the obstacles? 10 is hardest

fields.label: Why does this idea win?
fields.helperText: What made the difference in your evaluation

fields.label: What concerns you most about your winner?
What do you still need to learn before committing?
fields.helperText: Questions to answer before running numbers tomorrow

fields.label: Chosen idea name
fields.helperText: The idea you selected from Day 4. Example: Resume Review Service

fields.label: Offer name
fields.helperText: What you will call this when you sell it. Example: The 24-Hour Resume Fix

fields.label: Who pays
fields.helperText: Describe the person who would pay for this. Example: Job seekers with 3 to 10 years of experience

fields.label: What they get
fields.helperText: Describe what the customer receives. Be specific. Example: A rewritten resume plus a 15 minute video review

fields.label: Price Option A (low)
fields.helperText: Your lowest reasonable price in dollars. Example: 50

fields.label: Price Option B (middle)
fields.helperText: Your middle price in dollars. Example: 100

fields.label: Price Option C (high)
fields.helperText: Your highest reasonable price in dollars. Example: 200

fields.label: Price you will test first
fields.helperText: Which price option will you start with and why. Example: Option B at $100 because it matches competitors

fields.label: Expected sales per month (optimistic)
fields.helperText: How many sales per month in your best reasonable case. Example: 10

fields.label: Expected sales per month (conservative)
fields.helperText: How many sales per month if things go slower than hoped. Example: 4

fields.label: Direct cost per sale
fields.helperText: Variable cost for each sale in dollars. Include materials, transaction fees, etc. Example: 5

fields.label: Monthly fixed costs
fields.helperText: Total fixed monthly costs in dollars. Include software, hosting, subscriptions. Example: 30

fields.label: Minutes to fulfill one sale
fields.helperText: How many minutes of your time to deliver one sale. Example: 90

fields.label: Your target monthly profit
fields.helperText: How much profit per month would make this worthwhile for you. Example: 500

fields.label: Optimistic monthly revenue
fields.helperText: Price times optimistic sales. Example: 100 times 10 equals 1000

fields.label: Conservative monthly revenue
fields.helperText: Price times conservative sales. Example: 100 times 4 equals 400

fields.label: Optimistic monthly profit
fields.helperText: Optimistic revenue minus all costs. Example: 1000 minus 50 minus 30 equals 920

fields.label: Conservative monthly profit
fields.helperText: Conservative revenue minus all costs. Example: 400 minus 20 minus 30 equals 350

fields.label: Break-even sales count
fields.helperText: How many sales needed to cover fixed costs. Fixed costs divided by profit per sale. Example: 30 divided by 95 equals 1

fields.label: Hours per month (optimistic scenario)
fields.helperText: Minutes per sale times optimistic sales divided by 60. Example: 90 times 10 divided by 60 equals 15 hours

fields.label: Effective hourly rate (optimistic)
fields.helperText: Optimistic profit divided by optimistic hours. Example: 920 divided by 15 equals 61 dollars per hour

fields.label: Conservative scenario summary
fields.helperText: Describe the conservative case in plain language. Example: At 4 sales per month at $100, I profit $350 and work about 6 hours. That is $58 per hour.

fields.label: Optimistic scenario summary
fields.helperText: Describe the optimistic case in plain language. Example: At 10 sales per month at $100, I profit $920 and work about 15 hours. That is $61 per hour.

fields.label: What would improve the numbers fastest
fields.helperText: Name 1 to 3 things that would make the math better. Example: Raising the price to $150, reducing time per sale by using templates

fields.label: Does conservative profit meet your target
fields.helperText: Compare conservative profit to your target
options: Yes it meets or exceeds my target

fields.label: Decision: Is this idea worth pursuing
fields.helperText: Based on your forecast, should you continue with this idea into Week 2. Explain your reasoning.

fields.label: Idea A: Name
fields.helperText: Example: Resume Review Service

fields.label: Idea A: One sentence summary
fields.helperText: What is it and who is it for

fields.label: Idea A: Feasibility
fields.helperText: Can you do this with current skills and time

fields.label: Idea A: Profitability
fields.helperText: Does the math look attractive

fields.label: Idea A: Persuasion (why now)
fields.helperText: Is there urgency or clear demand

fields.label: Idea A: Efficiency (speed to execute)
fields.helperText: How fast can you launch and test

fields.label: Idea A: Motivation (excitement)
fields.helperText: How excited are you about this

fields.label: Final pick to commit
fields.helperText: Your primary idea for the next 7 days

fields.label: Backup pick
fields.helperText: Fallback if primary fails fast

fields.label: What you are shelving for now
fields.helperText: Ideas you are setting aside. You can return to them later.

fields.label: Your commitment
fields.helperText: Complete: For the next 7 days, I will focus on _____

fields.label: Your chosen idea name
fields.helperText: From Day 6

fields.label: Competitor 1: Name
fields.helperText: Example: ResumeWorded

fields.label: Competitor 1: What they sell in one line
Competitor 1: Price range
fields.helperText: Example: $49 to $149

fields.label: Competitor 1: What is missing or annoying
5 phrases customers use
fields.helperText: Copy short phrases from reviews or comments. Example: I needed this faster, The price was too high for what I got

fields.label: Gap hypothesis 1
fields.helperText: Something you could do differently. Example: Offer same-day turnaround

fields.label: Your differentiation statement
fields.helperText: Complete: I am different because _____

fields.label: Proof you can deliver this angle
fields.helperText: What experience or capability backs this up

fields.label: Avatar name
fields.helperText: Give them a real name. Example: Sarah

fields.label: In what way is this person similar to you?
fields.helperText: Example: They are a working parent who feels overwhelmed

fields.label: Role (job, student, parent, etc.)
fields.helperText: Example: Marketing manager at a small company

fields.label: Biggest frustration related to your offer
fields.helperText: What bothers them most. Example: I spend hours on my resume and still get no callbacks

fields.label: What they fear will happen if nothing changes
fields.helperText: Example: I will stay stuck in this job I hate

fields.label: What they secretly want
fields.helperText: The outcome they dream about but might not say. Example: Confidence that my resume actually works

fields.label: What they tried before
fields.helperText: Example: Used free templates, asked a friend, hired a cheap service

fields.label: What they hate about current options
fields.helperText: Example: Too generic, too slow, too expensive for what I got

fields.label: What would make them trust you
fields.helperText: Example: Seeing before/after examples, a quick response, a real person behind it

fields.label: Q&A 1: What question would you ask them?
If I help them, the outcome is _____
fields.helperText: Example: They get callbacks within a week

fields.label: Short letter to your avatar (150-250 words)
fields.helperText: Write like a human to a human. Show you understand them. No marketing speak.

fields.label: Offer name
fields.helperText: Example: The 24-Hour Resume Fix

fields.label: Who it is for
fields.helperText: From your Day 8 avatar. Example: Job seekers with 3 to 10 years of experience

fields.label: The promise (plain language)
fields.helperText: In plain language, what change happens? Example: You get a resume that gets callbacks

fields.label: What exactly do they receive
fields.helperText: Be specific. Example: A rewritten resume plus a 10-minute video review

fields.label: What is not included
fields.helperText: Set expectations. Example: Does not include cover letters or LinkedIn rewrites

fields.label: One-sentence pitch
fields.helperText: I help [who] do [what] so that [result]

fields.label: Five-sentence pitch
fields.helperText: Expand: problem, solution, how it works, outcome, call to action

fields.label: Price point (dollars)
fields.helperText: Example: 99

fields.label: Why this price is fair
fields.helperText: Connect price to outcome value

fields.label: Version A (Basic) name
fields.helperText: Example: Resume Review

fields.label: Version B (Premium) name
fields.helperText: Example: Full Resume Rewrite

fields.label: Differences between versions
fields.helperText: What does premium add

fields.label: Risk reversal
fields.helperText: What if they are not happy

fields.label: Where you will find first 3 customers
What you will ask them to do
fields.helperText: Example: Fill out a form and pay via link

fields.label: The moment you noticed the problem
fields.helperText: Where were you, what happened. Example: I was applying for jobs and getting no responses despite years of experience

fields.label: Why you care
fields.helperText: What made this personal. Example: I wasted months before I figured it out

fields.label: Why you are credible
fields.helperText: What proof or experience do you have. Example: I have helped 50 friends land interviews

fields.label: Who you want to help
fields.helperText: Example: Job seekers who feel invisible

fields.label: Your mission in one sentence
fields.helperText: Example: To help job seekers get seen

fields.label: The turning point that made you act
fields.helperText: What shifted. Example: A friend used my advice and got 3 interviews in a week

fields.label: How your offer solves it
fields.helperText: Connect story to offer. Example: That is why I created the 24-Hour Resume Fix

fields.label: 50-word story
fields.helperText: Example: I spent 6 months applying with no results. When I rewrote my resume using a new approach, I got 5 interviews in 2 weeks. Now I help others do the same.

fields.label: If your hustle has a give-back element, describe it
fields.helperText: Optional. Example: I offer free reviews for recent graduates

fields.label: Where you will place this story
Which nuts and bolts did you set up today?
fields.helperText: Check all the spine pieces you already have or set up today

fields.label: What is the biggest missing piece right now?
fields.helperText: The one thing blocking you from launching. Example: No landing page to explain my offer

fields.label: What is your most resourceful shortcut to get it done fast?
fields.helperText: Example: Use a free Carrd template, borrow a friend's Notion layout, copy a competitor's structure

fields.label: Who or what will you ask for help today?
fields.helperText: A person, community, template, tool, or tutorial. Example: Ask my designer friend for a quick logo, use Canva templates

fields.label: I drafted a basic agreement (what, how much, when)
Paste your basic agreement in 3 lines (what, how much, when)
fields.helperText: Example: I will deliver a 30-minute coaching call within 7 days. Cost is $75. Payment due before the call via PayPal.

fields.label: Your next action in the next 24 hours (one sentence)
fields.helperText: Example: Set up a Carrd landing page and share the link with 3 friends for feedback

fields.label: What are you selling today? (one sentence offer)
fields.helperText: Example: A 60-minute resume rewrite plus a 15-minute feedback call

fields.label: Direct cash cost per sale (fees, materials, shipping, tools)
fields.helperText: Add up platform fees, materials, shipping, and any tool costs per sale. Example: 5

fields.label: Time cost per sale (hours, realistic estimate)
fields.helperText: Include prep, delivery, and follow-up. Be honest. Example: 2.5

fields.label: Minimum hourly value you want (or equivalent)
fields.helperText: The minimum you are willing to earn per hour. Example: 25

fields.label: Your minimum workable price (cost-plus result)
fields.helperText: Formula: (hours x hourly value) + cash costs. Example: (2.5 x 25) + 5 = 67.50

fields.label: Your starting launch price
fields.helperText: A realistic price between your minimum and what the market can bear. Example: 75

fields.label: Pricing model you will use (for now)
Why this price makes sense (and how it feels to publish it)
fields.helperText: Example: $75 covers my costs and gives me $25 per hour. It feels slightly scary but fair for the value.

fields.label: Write your 3-step recipe (Step 1 create, Step 2 publish, Step 3 revenue)
fields.helperText: Example: Step 1: Record video tutorials. Step 2: Upload to Gumroad with sales page. Step 3: Share link and accept payment.

fields.label: List the ingredients you must source or create (tools, assets, access, help)
fields.helperText: Example: Screen recording software, microphone, Gumroad account, thumbnail designs, email template

fields.label: List the deliverables the customer receives (exact items)
fields.helperText: Example: 5 video lessons (10 min each), 1 PDF checklist, 1 template spreadsheet, access to private Discord

fields.label: What is the single most urgent missing ingredient?
fields.helperText: The one thing blocking progress. Example: Screen recording software

fields.label: Where will you get it within 48 hours? (link, shop, person, platform)
fields.helperText: Example: Download Loom free trial from loom.com

fields.label: Estimated cost to acquire the urgent ingredient
fields.helperText: Enter 0 if free. Example: 0

fields.label: Which payment method(s) will you accept at launch?
fields.helperText: Check all that apply for your first launch

fields.label: Paste your payment link or checkout URL
fields.helperText: Example: https://pay.stripe.com/link123 or your Gumroad product page

fields.label: I tested the payment flow end to end (pay, confirmation, delivery)
Write your one-sentence refund policy
fields.helperText: Example: Full refund if you are not satisfied within 7 days, no questions asked.

fields.label: Write your one-sentence delivery promise (what happens after they pay)
fields.helperText: Example: You will receive a confirmation email with download link within 5 minutes of purchase.

fields.label: Paste your basic agreement (what you do, how much, when paid)
fields.helperText: Your 3-line agreement from Day 11, updated with any changes

fields.label: Support email customers should use
fields.helperText: Example: help@yoursite.com or your personal email

fields.label: Write your workflow from discovery to delivery (numbered steps)
fields.helperText: At least 12 steps. Example: 1. Customer finds landing page. 2. Reads offer. 3. Clicks buy...

fields.label: Write 4 onboarding messages (welcome, how to start, tips, check-in)
fields.helperText: 1. Welcome message with next steps. 2. How to get started. 3. One helpful tip. 4. Check-in after a few days.

fields.label: What could go wrong? Select your top risks
fields.helperText: Check the most likely failure points for your workflow

fields.label: For 2 risks, write the fix and the exact message you will send
fields.helperText: Example: Risk 1: Customer did not get email. Fix: Check spam, resend manually. Message: Hi! I noticed you might not have received my email. Here it is again...

fields.label: One automation or template you will build next (one sentence)
fields.helperText: Example: Create a Zapier automation to send confirmation emails

fields.label: Where will you store customer info and orders?
fields.helperText: Example: Google Sheet, Notion database, Airtable, CRM

fields.label: How clear is the customer benefit today?
fields.helperText: 1 = very unclear, 5 = crystal clear

fields.label: How clear is your income plan today?
fields.helperText: 1 = very unclear, 5 = crystal clear

fields.label: List 3 actions that improve customer benefit (specific)
fields.helperText: Example: 1. Add a quick-start checklist to the product. 2. Record a walkthrough video. 3. Simplify the first step.

fields.label: List 3 actions that increase income (specific)
fields.helperText: Example: 1. Send 3 outreach DMs to potential customers. 2. Post the offer on LinkedIn. 3. Ask a happy customer for a referral.

fields.label: List 3 low-value tasks you will stop or postpone
fields.helperText: Example: 1. Stop tweaking the logo. 2. Pause social media scheduling setup. 3. Defer building an email sequence.

fields.label: Your 25-minute Make Something block for tomorrow morning (exact task)
fields.helperText: Example: Tomorrow at 7am I will write the welcome email sequence

fields.label: I will spend 10 percent more time on:
Sales page/listing finalized with offer + price
Where did you share it? (link or description)
How does it feel to be live?
10 people who match your ideal customer profile
Summary of responses (what did they say?)
10 people in your network who might help
Who said yes? What did they offer?
Improvement made to offer or messaging
What made the sale happen (or what's blocking it)?
If no sale: 3 most likely paths to first sale
Biggest bottleneck (where are people dropping off?)
How to 2x effort on what's working
People who showed interest but didn't buy
Customer acquisition workflow: How do people find you?
Sales process: How do people buy?
Delivery process: How do you fulfill?
The single biggest lever to pull next month
Recurring time scheduled for side hustle
fields.helperText: e.g., Tues/Thurs 7-8pm
